accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four series: Subject files; Audiovisual materials; John Perry records; and Unprocessed accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The North Pacific Program (1985-1995) was part of the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy. Directed by John Curtis Perry, the program endeavored to examine the political, economic, intellectual, and cultural trends of the countries that fall on the Pacific Rim. The countries represented in the program were the United States, Canada, Mexico, the former Soviet Union, China, Japan, North Korea, and South Korea. The program was not a formal field of study; rather it focused on enhancing the Fletcher curriculum with classes on culture and economics from the area of the North Pacific.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Lauren Miller, supervised by Susanne Belovari. Processing notes: This collection was processed in Summer 2008. The collection had no original order and it was decided that the materials should be arranged into subject files and audio visual material. An initial examination of the material revealed that some pages had been damp but no mold was readily apparent. The following preservation measures were taken: refoldering, discarding rusty staples and paper clips, and photocopying of thermal faxes. The following items were weeded from the collection: duplicate programs and VHS cassette tapes. Titles in brackets are taken from discarded hanging folders. Also included in the collection is a floppy disk titles 'North Pacific Program Disk'. Veronica Martzahl made a digital object of the disk which can be found at DGB UA189.001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection documents the North Pacific Program directed by John Curtis Perry at Tufts University. Materials include correspondence, newspaper articles, student papers, funding research, photographs and video tapes from 1985 to 1995. The primary focus of the collection is the planning associated with running the annual North Pacific Program seminar. This collection also contains seminar schedules and trip itineraries, reports, budgets, and audiocassette tapes of lectures at the Fletcher School's North Pacific Program (NPP), and information about guest lecturers from the Sanwa Lecture Series, which was run by the NPP.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence, newspaper articles, student papers, and funding research for the North Pacific Program from 1985 to 1995. The bulk of the material is correspondence concerning the organization of the annual field seminar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes photographs and videocassettes documenting the North Pacific Program from 1985 to 1995. The bulk of the photographs are from the annual field seminar and the videocassettes also feature lectures from the seminar. The majority of the photographs are labeled as to which year they were taken but few have any people identified.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged loosely chronologically.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains original correspondence, seminar schedules and trip itineraries, reports, budgets, and audiocassette tapes of lectures at the Fletcher School's North Pacific Program (NPP). These materials were created or collected by John C. Perry, who founded the NPP and taught East Asian and Maritime Studies at the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy from 1980 - 2015. The majority of the materials consist of correspondence between Perry and his international colleagues and students. The series also contains information about guest lecturers from the Sanwa Lecture Series, which was run by the NPP. The bulk of this series was created from 1980 - 2018.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of John C. Perry, 2018, accession MS-2019-042.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Darcy Foster and Leah Edelman in 2019. Materials were placed in archival boxes if the original housing was damaged, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Received rough chronological order was maintained. A file level inventory was created via spreadsheet and imported, and series and collection level descriptions were updated at the time of processing.
